intro: Gymnosporia neglecta, commonly known as the African burr bush, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers followed by woody pods containing seeds with hooked spines. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh conditions. Gymnosporia neglecta is often used in traditional medicine and for its hardy, drought-tolerant nature.
